Articles.Content:
It crashes each time on different places.

These are the mods installed (recommended + a few more)

Here is the Log File

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_W4IdZNEouTeFZRUkpDejlkSms/view?usp=sharing

Please help me, I've tried now for two entire days and I'm a bit desesperate!

Edited October 19, 2015 by 3enrique
You've got waaaaaay too many part packs. Start with just the required and recommended (NOT suggested) mods.

You've got waaaaaay too many part packs. Start with just the required and recommended (NOT suggested) mods.

I've done what you told me but although now it goes better, the game crashed when trying to go to space centre and EVA:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_W4IdZNEouTTmxtMm11TzVYWnM/view?usp=sharing

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_W4IdZNEouTN3Vlb3lzREFTNkE/view?usp=sharing
Ok, can you show your modlist for that install then?

Ok, can you show your modlist for that install then?

Here:
You still have a lot of part packs. Please follow my original advice.

You still have a lot of part packs. Please follow my original advice.

It is just so difficult to choose which ones to take... Which ones would you take?

It is just so difficult to choose which ones to take... Which ones would you take?

i think its not about prefering parts but to find out which causes the crashing... so just try to play some hours with half of the parts- after that with the other half. (Or better: start with stock-parts only)

so you can break down the list of mods that might cause a crash to the half...

repeat this with that half that still caused a crash

basic debugging step-by-step

You still have a lot of part packs. Please follow my original advice.
i think its not about prefering parts but to find out which causes the crashing... so just try to play some hours with half of the parts- after that with the other half. (Or better: start with stock-parts only)

so you can break down the list of mods that might cause a crash to the half...

repeat this with that half that still caused a crash

basic debugging step-by-step

I've managed to make it work! And got my first satellite on orbit!

However when trying to use some engines (I think they are from real plume) they have the attach node to high and there is a separation between the fuel tank and the engine, what am I doing wrong?

Congrats!

KW Community fixes is still broken for RO. You will have to manually remove it. Or just don't use KW at all until it's fixed.
